verb.description: Express the meaning of (the writer or speaker or something written or spoken) using different words, especially to achieve greater clarity.
examples: you can either quote or paraphrase literary texts

noun.description: A rewording of something written or spoken by someone else.

origin: Mid 16th century (as a noun): via Latin from Greek paraphrasis, from paraphrazein, from para- (expressing modification) + phrazein tell.
